snippet: The assault, expected to begin in April or May, will require 20,000 to 25,000 Iraqi and Kurdish troops, an official from the United States Central Command said.
abstract: United States Central Command says push to retake Mosul, Iraq, from Islamic State extremists is planned for April or May 2015 and will involve 20,000 to 25,000 Iraq and Kurdish troops; unusually candid announcement, made at White House's counterterrorism conference, is intended deflect criticism that Iraq is lagging in effort to rout militants.
lead_paragraph: The assault, expected to begin in April or May, will require 20,000 to 25,000 Iraqi and Kurdish troops, an official from the United States Central Command said.

headline.main: Iraqi Assault to Retake Mosul From Islamic State Is Planned for Spring
headline.print_headline: Assault to Retake Iraqi City From Islamic State Is Planned for Spring

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
